sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin says referenda in occupied Ukrainian territories will take place from Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Military reserves have been mobilized and that Moscow will retaliate if threatened.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Violent protests rock Iran over a young woman's arrest and death while in the custody of the morality police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So far, at least seven have died in the unrest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In a move seen as an escalation by the West, Russian President Vladimir Putin has announced a partial military mobilization in Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In a televised address to the nation, he said that 300,000 reservists will now be called up to fight in Ukraine to, quote, ensure Russian territorial integrity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Well, it comes as Russian-backed officials say that they plan to hold so-called referenda in Luhansk, Donetsk, Kherson and Zaporizhia from Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: U.S., Germany and France have said that they'd never recognize the results of what they've called sham ballots.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Well, with me now is Peter Dickinson, Ukraine editor at the Atlantic Council, joining us from Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Peter, great to have you with us once again. How will Ukraine be reacting to Putin's address?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Well, Ukraine itself has been quite clear that it will pay very little attention, essentially, to Putin's address. They regard it as a bluff. They regard it as a sign of recognition, rare public recognition that Russia is losing the war. And they see it as more of the same, really. They've heard this sort of rhetoric before. They've heard threats before along the lines of what we've heard today. And the the referendums are regarded as as illegitimate. And they sign that Russia is looking to to freeze the conflict because it sees the way the wind is blowing so to speak. You see that he's losing. Ukraine is advancing and Putin is desperate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Even if the ballots are viewed as illegitimate by Ukraine and by nations such as France, the UK, the US and Germany, nevertheless, how important is it that they are happening from Friday in conjunction with this announcement from Putin?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Putin is going to state his referendums. Of course, they will be passed by the large majorities. The assumption is the results are already decided. And then very quickly, perhaps immediately, Putin will declare that these parts of Russia, these parts of Ukraine, rather, are now parts of the Russian Federation. Now, that does change the calculus, because then Ukraine's continued offensive actions, Ukraine's attempts to liberate its own territory, will be labeled by Russia as attacks on the Russian Federation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And that then brings into play potentially the nuclear question.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russia's military doctrine specifically states that attacks on the use of nuclear weapons is only admissible if the Russian Federation's existence and territorial integrity is under threat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Now, clearly, that is what Putin is very unsubtly hinting at.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He is saying, if you continue your offensives, once I've claimed this territory, I may use nuclear weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: How is Ukraine reacting to Vladimir Putin's address and his plans for what he calls a partial mobilisation of the military?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: What does it mean for the current situation on the ground in Ukraine as four regions face referenda held on them joining Russia from Friday in ballots which the West have described as a sham. Well to discuss all of this now I'm joined by our correspondent Sasha Vakulina. Sasha firstly

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: what has the reaction been in Ukraine to the announcement from Vladimir Putin?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The reaction was this does not change things much for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Of course, Putin's address was for to his nation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: That was the address to the Russians to announce this, as he says, partial mobilization, but also to justify to explain why he says Russians will be mobilized now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Talking again about the nuclear threats from the West talking about the West threatening Russia or what happened what is happening in Ukraine but for Ukrainians and this is something we have heard today from the authorities and the officials in in Ukraine this was a rather predictable step but it doesn't change much what is happening in Ukraine this is seen in Ukraine as a reaction of Vladimir Putin and his authorities to the efficient and successful counter-offensive in the northeast of Ukraine and specifically is what happened with the withdrawal of Russian troops in Kharkiv but that doesn't change much on the ground. We're talking about the situation on the ground as you say we've seen Ukraine retake a good deal of territory there in the northeast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And what would more troops coming in mean for the battle? What is the situation right now?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Well, it also depends on how quickly they can join the battle, how quickly they can be on the ground, how well trained they will be and how ready for that fighting they will be.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Because now we're talking about Ukrainian counteroffensive moving slowly to the east from northeast, from Kharkiv going towards Luhansk there's massive fighting now happening over the town of Ulyman and this is really heavy fighting how prepared would be the newly mobilized Russian troops for that one also the counter-offensive still continues in the south of Ukraine this is the region of Harrison so again Ukraine strategy its tactics its situation on the ground hasn't changed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The counteroffensive in Ukraine continues by the troops in multiple directions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The simple act of burning a headscarf. In a Western country, authorities wouldn't bat an eyelid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In Iran, it's an open act of defiance against the state's tough morality laws. It's all part of a massive wave of revolt triggered by the death of Masha Amini, a 22 year old woman who was arrested by the morality police for wearing a headscarf in a quote inappropriate manner. So far at least seven people have died in the unrest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And it's the scale of these protests that have taken authorities by surprise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At least 15 cities across the country recorded disturbances, with some being violent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the northern city of Sari, this woman openly hit and then burned a picture of the supreme Iranian leader.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In response, authorities have used tear gas against protesters and have made dozens of arrests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The United States will invest 100 million euros to form a new cooperation of Atlantic bordering nations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The U.S. already spends around 400 million euros yearly on maritime programs in the Atlantic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: 400 million euros yearly on maritime programs in the Atlantic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: During the UN General Assembly in New York, US Secretary of State joined his counterparts from countries like Brazil and Portugal in order to discuss the new grouping of around 10 countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We recognize the importance of expanding support for and working with existing Atlantic initiatives, Portugal's leadership in creating the Atlantic Center in the Azores, Brazil's vision of a zone of peace and cooperation in the South Atlantic, the Friends of the Gulf of Guinea, efforts that continue to make significant – to have a significant impact.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Still, as challenges mount and our innovations and opportunities expand, we believe our partnerships need to grow to meet those challenges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The initiative also aims to improve economic growth and fight climate change and piracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This comes as U.S. President Joe Biden's administration puts a growing focus on environmental cooperation around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: environmental cooperation around the world. Rising food prices, startling energy bills and frustration with politicians and employers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That's what brought 10,000 people to the streets of Brussels on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Dressed in red, green and blue, the colours of the three main unions. The anger was palpable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Protesters want politicians to take action now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I've been working for the past 23 years and now is the first time I'm having real difficulties to survive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: We need to fight against the increasing prices and the energy bills.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Life in general is getting very unbearable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I count on my government to fix the problem. If there is a conflict between Ukraine and Russia or geopolitics, I don't care.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Another big complaint among protesters, their lack of purchasing power. They want a law from 1996 on workers' well-being modified so that trade unions can negotiate pay rises with the Belgian political landscape. It's complex.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We have different kinds of governments and we have in the Flemish speaking part, the Dutch speaking part, they're not doing anything. And they have the money, but they're saying, oh, we want our balances, our public finances in check, so we're not giving anything. But they need to help the people now. So there are different kinds of governments who aren't doing anything.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's not normal, it's not acceptable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Similar protests have swept across Europe of late, from Greece to Austria to the Czech Republic, with families and workers alike worried about what the immediate future may hold.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Today is just the start of what could be a winter of discontent here in Belgium with the general strike planned for November.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Maeve McMahon, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A cloned Arctic wolf in China could soon lead the way to helping preserve endangered species.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The wolf named Maya was born through the same technique that created Dolly the sheep,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: the first cloned mammal in 1996.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Maya was formed inside the womb of a beagle, who was both her surrogate mother and her playmate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And she was cloned from another wolf that had died from old age ten months ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The newly born wolf has the same genome as the original wolf.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But the cloned wolf hasn't lived with other wolves, but with a dog.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In fact, for cloned pet dogs and cats, there is also a problem of early socialization.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The earlier the socialization, the better it is for its future development.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The genetics company behind the project says it will now conduct research on how to preserve

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: endangered animals in China, as the world could soon head towards another mass extinction event.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But some in the scientific community have raised concerns, specifically when it comes to the health of cloned animals and how it will affect biodiversity.
